page.title: 14THE MUSHROOM FARM GRT.BADDOW
page.content: During the last war the army was billetted in Baddow Park House. The family who bought the house and land decided to go into the mushroom business, as mushrooms then were a luxury item. The mushrooms are grown on horse manure which mostly comes from the stables at Newmarket-about 60 tons a week. The manure is put into piles and sprayed with water. It is turned three times a week. Then it is sterilised and put into crates with the mushroom spawn. The spawn is grown on sterilised wheat. The wheat grain has to be sterilised so that the wheat will not grow.This is then mixed with the compost and when the spawn has grown through,a mixture of peat and chalk is put on top.
